name: Private Guided Tour of the Automotive Wonders of the World!
description: For a limited group of individuals, we will open out a treasure trove hidden in Bangalore! You will get to experience the restoration, preservation & collection of Historic Cars, Motorcycles, Carriages and all things automotive passionately built over the past 40 years!

location.address: Rajarajeshwari Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: Classic Chase
organizer.description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

name: Sunday Breakfast: Banter & Retrogrades
description: Join us for a Sunday breakfast table where we laugh, roast, and decode the drama of the cosmos.Expect astro games, rants, planetary impersonations, and lots of cosmic giggles. No astrology knowledge needed—just come with your brunch appetite and a curious, playful vibe.Because when in doubt… blame it on the stars. 🌟

location.address: 24, Vittal Mallya Rd, KG Halli, D' Souza Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: HighTable is a unique social experience where you get to dine with 4-10 people and engage in meaningful conversations. Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Aperitivo Italiano - Cicchetti e Vino in Bengaluru
description: Bengaluru, Sip & Savour Italy – One Glass at a TimeStep into a slice of Italy in the heart of Bengaluru! Aperitivo Italiano, part of IICCI’s Project Il Dolce Vino, invites you to an evening of exquisite wines, gourmet Italian delicacies, and expert-led tastings at the iconic Italia – The Park.Meet fellow wine lovers, connect with Indo-Italian business and lifestyle enthusiasts, and enjoy a vibrant cultural experience over glasses of fine Italian wine.🔹 Join us for an evening of La Dolce Vita – Bengaluru style!Note: Only one booking per person is allowed.

location.address: The Park, 14/7 14 7, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: Il Dolce Vino
organizer.description: Il Dolce Vino, by IICCI, promotes authentic Italian food and wine in India. It supports Italian exports via exclusive Wine Clubs in key cities, offering events, awareness programs, curated wine tours, and expert-led training, uniting the Indo-Italian food and wine community.

name: MEDITATIVE PAINTING
description: Meditative Painting is a slow, thoughtful approach to art, using acrylic ink and continuous line drawing to explore movement and form. With an emphasis on process over outcome, the practice encourages a more intuitive way of working; embracing flow, experimentation, and quiet observation. Through repetition and gentle focus, it becomes as much a reflective practice as a creative one. About your Instructors Divya Rao is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

location.address: 171, 3rd Cross Rd, Central Excise Layout, Sanjayanagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560094, India

organizer.name: Balsamic Walls
organizer.description: BalsamicWalls offers curated, 100% hand-painted abstract art for modern Indian spaces. We provide diverse, affordable pieces in various sizes and work with residential, commercial, and industrial clients on commissions, decor, and gifting.

name: Coffee & Convo: Falling Flat, Rising Fabulous!
description: Sometimes we trip, spill our coffee, and question all our life choices before 9 AM.☕But hey—growth is messy, caffeinated, and often comes with a side of oversharing.Through heart-to-hearts and hot brews, we regroup, reframe, and rise like the fabulous phoenixes we are.Falling flat? Please. We’re just warming up for a legendary glow-up 💬

location.address: Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: HighTable is a unique social experience where you get to dine with 4-10 people and engage in meaningful conversations. Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

location.address: 15K, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Travel With Kids @ Coro
description: Join us for a cozy fireside chat with Travel With Kids - the go-to guide for jet-setting families! Whether you're dreaming of your first trip with your toddler or figuring out how to manage airports with a stroller, this is the space to ask it all.👩‍👧‍👦 And guess what? While you sip, chat, and plan your next adventure, your little ones can explore the magic of Coro’s Playscape downstairs - supervised and full of joy!📍 Coro, 2nd Floor🗓️ Mother’s Day: Saturday, May 10🕰️ 11AM - 1PM💬 Seats are limited, so grab your mom friends and RSVP now!Let’s celebrate the moms who make everything possible, even travel with toddlers. 💼✈️🧡

location.address: XJ6P+7VC, Kempegowda Service Rd, near Paramahansa Yogananda Road, Domlur I Stage, 1st Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Write Like a Pro
description: Are you keen on becoming a published features writer? Do you want to learn how to build on your curiosity and ideas?Join our online workshop, Write like a Pro, where we teach you the fundamentals of taking your ideas from inception to publication. The workshop is facilitated by Saritha and Suchi, published writers with over 20 years of experience each.📅 Sat May 3, 2025 -- 10 am to 5 pm

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: An Evening of Indulgence with Wine & Cigar
description: Step into an immersive evening where bold flavors, elegant rituals, and refined indulgence come together at The Pour Room. This is a curated wine and cigar pairing experience designed for those who appreciate the finer things — or are ready to explore them.This exclusive evening will showcase two distinct wines — a full-bodied Chardonnay with its rich, buttery notes of tropical fruit and oak, and a deep, structured Cabernet Sauvignon & Sangiovese blend. Each will be thoughtfully paired with Rocky Patel cigars that elevate and complement their profiles — .You’ll not only taste, but learn — how to cut, light, and smoke a cigar with finesse, how to swirl and sip your wine like a sommelier, and how pairing the right cigar can unlock entirely new flavor dimensions.Whether you’re a seasoned aficionado or a curious first-timer, this is your invitation to a night of luxury, learning, and laid-back conversation. Come for the flavor, stay for the experience.

location.address: 1st Floor, 5th Block, 136, 1st Cross Road, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560034, India

organizer.name: The Pour Room
organizer.description: A collaborative space by Blue Tokai and Fratelli, focused on coffee, wine, and experimental experiences.

name: Spirited Away - Summer Retreat (1 or 2 nights)
description: Come away with us to where the green grass grows! This is no ordinary summer retreat. Instead, we've designed a perfect mix of art, activity and leisure. And of course, you can also simply sit back and take in the summer air. Set in a lovely organic farm off the grid, Spirited Away is your chance to reset and energise yourself.Bring friends, bring partners, bring your entire family. Be it seniors or kids, we've got something for everyone.We have five facilitators on board to help you make the most of your stay. They bring expertise and experience, but most importantly, they bring passion. With them, you can see the world through a new lens -- and who knows, you could go back with a new hobby!What's on the menu? Cycling | Hiking | YogaArt | Poetry | PhotographyOrganic Farming | Birdwatching | Nature WalksAlso on the cards: Games, Quizzes, and an exclusive outdoor Movie ScreeningHow long is the retreat? We have two options:1 Day Away/ Spirited Away Once - Arrive May 9 Friday 6pm, depart May 10 Saturday 6pm2 Days Away / Spirited Away Twice - Arrive May 9 Friday 6pm, depart May 11 Sunday 12pmAccomodation: Acommodation has been arranged at a beautiful homestay called Rocky Ridge Earthy Cottages with attached bath (Exclusively for early-bird registrations!)Rustic Tents with clean bathroom facilitiies right nextdoorFood: Farm-fresh meals with multicuisine options and foodie favouritesFacilitators Dheeraj Subramanian - Co-founder of Pedal in Tandem, Bicycle Tour GuidePoojya Basavaraj - Co-founder of Pedal in Tandem, Bicycle Tour Guide, Yoga InstructorRadha Rangarajan - Writer, Photographer & NaturalistSuchi Govindarajan - Writer, Poet & Nature-GuideGirish - Organic Farmer & Owner of Rocky Ridge FarmITINERARY09-May-2025 Check in by early evening and start your holiday------------------------	10-May-2025Choose your own adventure -Birdwatching & Yoga : Find birdsong and balance before heading to breakfastOR Bicycle Ride : 20km or 40km through verdant country roadsLearn Something new -Bicycle Mechanics : Learn to make the most of your machineOR Organic farming : Learn about natural practices at the farmCreative Afternoon -Phone Photography : Learn to photograph like a pro OR Poetry & Art : Discover your inner artistEasy Sunset Hike -Hike to a nearby hill and enjoy the sunset & valley panoramaQuiz & Movie night -Fun quiz with the group and enjoy a special movie------------------------11-May-2025Sunrise ride and walk in a Reserve forest -Ride on a tractor to a beautiful lake and walk through the forestPicnic breakfast and Mindfulness session -Walk up a beautiful hill and restore body and mind------------------------

location.address: Survey No. 74/3, Anna Nagar, Thadikal, Taluk, Denkanikottai, Tamil Nadu 635107, India

name: PAINT YOUR EMOTIONS
description: Intuitive exploration of feeling through colour, form, and movement. Rather than focusing on technique or representation, the practice invites a more instinctive response to emotion translating mood and energy onto the canvas. With a focus on process over outcome, it offers space for reflection, release, and discovery through paint.About your Instructors Divya Rao is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: In The House with Drywave, Bangkok - Bar Takeover
description: Wave Alert: Dry Wave Cocktail Studio Washes Over MUROOn May 3rd, Dry Wave Cocktail Studio, voted Best Bar in Thailand that's been shaking up the Bangkok scene, is taking over MURO. Led by Thai cocktail wizard Supawit ‘Palm’ Muttarattana, Dry Wave is known for Super Classics (a combination of 2 classic recipes) into totally new, “how-did-they-think-of-this?” concoctions. Expect bold creativity, seasonal vibes, and flavor waves you didn't see coming. Seriously , their cocktails are like edible soundtracks made from tree rings and beach foam.The name Dry Wave isn’t just cool to say, it’s a nod to the rhythms of the world around us. As Palm puts it: “We love art, and we find that waves are present in so much – from music and cocktails to marbled patterns, tree rings, and beaches.” That natural energy pulses through every pour.Whether you're a cocktail lover or just here for the vibes, this is your chance to catch Thong Lo’s most talked-about bar team bringing their signature magic to MURO.A glimpse of the menu: Love Train – Chocolate & berry bitters, gin, vanilla syrup, lemon. Smooth, a little sweet, with just enough edge.Morning Tijuana – Strawberry, capsicum, tequila, mezcal, vanilla, orange juice, lime. Bright, smoky, unexpected.1806 - 1988 – Cranberry & apple cider cordial, vermouth, orange bitters, kyoho liqueur, whiskey. Bold and balanced.Casoni Martini – Honey & thyme vodka, Campari, sweet + bianco vermouth, wild honey, espresso. Boozy, herbaceous, with a caffeine kick.Sea Sand Sun – Clarified rum, cranberry-tomato mix, white Penja pepper cordial, saline, ancho reyes, celery bitters. Savory, spiced, and unlike anything you’ve had before.

location.address: 5, Museum Rd, next to Toscano Restaurant, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

location.address: 5, Museum Rd, next to Toscano Restaurant, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: THE ART OF JOURNALING
description: "The Art of Journaling" is a reflective course focused on personal reconnection and present moment awareness. It integrates writing prompts and drawing practices to foster creative expression and emotional clarity. Grounded in mindfulness, the course aims to mitigate anxiety through structured reflection. Participants will develop a journaling habit through observation, mark-making, and storytelling exercises. No prior experience is required, only curiosity and a willingness to engage in self-reflection.About your Instructors Divya Rao is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: Movie Under The Stars | Screening: The Big Short
description: Join us for an open-air screening of The Big Short (2015), with a three-course dinner by Chef Rhea Aaron and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movie:It’s smart, sharp, and brilliantly unconventional. The Big Short dives into the chaos of the 2008 financial crisis with wit, energy, and a surprising dose of humor. With fast-paced storytelling, an incredible ensemble cast, and clever breaks of the fourth wall, it turns a complicated subject into a gripping, wildly entertaining ride that’s as enlightening as it is unforgettable.Why under the stars?Because it’s the kind of film that pairs perfectly with a cold breeze, a glass of wine, and a seriously good meal.3-course dinner by Chef Rhea AaronCourse 1:"Toxic Asset" Loaded NachosCourse 2:"Collateralised" Chicken StewOR"Collateralised" Veg Stew (served with dinner rolls)Course 3:Short Cake CrashFruit of the season inspired______Terms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Reiki Workshop 3rd & 4th May 2025
description: Reiki is an energy healing modality that originated in Japan. This is a Reiki Level 1 / first degree certification workshop to learn and become a Reiki Level 1 practitioner. Over the years, Reiki has branched out into multiple forms but the one you will learn here is Usui Shiki Ryoho - Traditional Usui System of Natural Healing (as taught and followed by the lineage of Dr. Mikao Usui, the founder of the Reiki System of Natural Healing). Kavitha & Anirudh are trained & certified in this very system and will share their knowledge and experience. There are 3 levels to learning Reiki. Each level progresses to equip you with greater knowledge of this energy healing. In this 2-day Level 1 workshop one will learn;Introduction to the Reiki systemGet in-depth knowledge of the chakra systemReiki concepts and their applicationsTouch-healing technique and get attunedGet certified as a level 1 practitioner post which one can start practicing on oneself & others immediately. Come join us for this workshop and empower yourself with Reiki

name: FUNDAMENTALS OF CANVAS PAINTING
description: This class offers a structured introduction to acrylic painting on canvas, covering essential techniques to build confidence and skill with the medium. Through guided exercises, participants will explore colour mixing, layering, brush control, and composition, learning how to create depth, texture, and balance in their work. The focus is on understanding acrylic properties, from blending and glazing to impasto techniques, while encouraging both precision and creative expression. Whether you’re a beginner or looking to refine your technique, this course provides a solid foundation for developing your own painting style.About your Instructors Divya Rao is a Still Life Photographer and Abstract Artist with a strong focus on colour, composition, and storytelling. With a background in Fashion and a Masters Degree from UAL London in Women’s Wear, she blends elements of still life, fashion, and street photography to create thoughtful, rooted imagery. Her work often incorporates silhouette manipulation, real flowers, botanical elements, and naturally formed objects, capturing both simplicity and depth.Beyond photography, Divya is obsessed with both Textile Design and heads the Fashion Portfolio division at Mount Carmel College, Bengaluru guiding students in shaping their creative voices. She brings a multidisciplinary approach to her work, always exploring new ways to tell visual narratives!

name: Whispers Within: Breathe, Feel, Heal
description: What is Circular Connected Breathing (CCB)?Circular Connected Breathing is a simple yet profound practice where the inhale and exhale flow continuously without noticeable pauses. This rhythmic breath anchors you into the body’s innate wisdom, calms the mind, and opens a gateway to emotional healing, deeper awareness, and self-integration. As the body relaxes into the breathing cycle, hidden memories, emotions, and insights can gently surface, offering a powerful space for transformation.About the Experience:There is a part of you that learned early to strive, survive, and stay strong but beneath it all, your inner child still carries the imprints of unmet needs, longings, and emotional wounds.In Whispers Within, a Circular Connected Breathing Journey held in a nurturing and gentle space, we create a bridge between your wise adult self and the tender child within. The Flow of the Journey:We begin with a soft grounding practice to arrive into the body and gently preparing the nervous system.You'll be invited to set an inner intention for the journey.From there, we move into the Circular Connected Breathing session, allowing the breath to guide you into deeper layers of emotional memory, connection, and healing.We will close with a gentle meditation, a short reflective writing exercise and an optional sharing circle to help integrate your experience with care and tenderness.Through breath and loving presence, you’ll be invited to:✨ Recognize the emotional patterns rooted in childhood experiences✨ Meet the needs of your inner child with compassion and understanding✨ Heal the push-pull between responsibility and emotional vulnerability✨ Reclaim spontaneity, softness, and emotional wholenessThis is not about fixing or forcing change.It’s about listening, honouring, and gently negotiating between your inner child and adult self so you can walk forward in life with more freedom and authenticity.Please bring:A yoga mat and anything you need to feel cozy lying down (scarf, eye mask, shawl, etc.)About the Facilitator:Maria is an intuitive healer and guide who transitioned from a thriving corporate career to the healing arts. With over 8 years of experience, she weaves Breathwork, Reiki, Tarot, Access Bars, Shadow Constellations, and psychotherapy-inspired methods into deeply grounding and expansive journeys. Her sessions create space for emotional, spiritual and energetic healing - inviting you to drop into your body, regulate your nervous system and return home to yourself.

location.address: 3rd floor, 35, 1st Cross Rd, near Honda Haiku Service center, K.R.Colony, Krishna Reddy Layout, Amarjyoti Layout, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Ethereal Vibes
organizer.description: Ethereal Vibes is where soulful healing meets cosmic sass. With 8+ years in energy work, I offer transformative sessions blending Breathwork, Reiki, Shadow Constellations, Access Bars and Tarot plus Reiki-infused products like chakra salts and crystal bracelets to support daily ritual and self-care.

name: Why We Watch - How Films Shape Who We Are!
description: Why We Watch” – How Films Shape Who We AreWelcome to the very first session of Dialogues with Cinema — we`re starting with something personal, something foundational.This session is not just about talking films. It’s about tracing the moments that made us fall in love with cinema — and asking why certain films stay with us. Whether it`s the one that cracked you open emotionally, reshaped your politics, made you feel seen, or just stuck with you for reasons you still can`t explain... this session is where we bring those films into the room.What to expect :– A guided, open-format discussion where each person brings in a film that’s meant something to them– Reflections on memory, identity, and how our personal histories shape our taste– Conversations that might be nostalgic, tender, surprising, even a little heated — because meaning is rarely neutral– A collective attempt to understand: Why do we watch? And what do these films do to us — culturally, emotionally, politically, psychologically?You don’t need to be a “film buff” to show up — but if you`re someone who feels things deeply when you watch a film, or who`s ever been changed by one, you’ll fit right in.We’ll end the session with a short, collective viewing — a curated piece that ties into the theme — followed by closing thoughts.Come with a film in your heart. Come with something to say. Come with an open mind.Let’s find out what happens when you put a group of people in a room and ask them to speak, not about film — but through it.Host - Venkatesh & Sri

name: Tarot Round Table
description: Join Us for a Circle Tarot Meetup!Are you ready to explore the mystical world of tarot? Join us for an enchanting evening of connection, insight, and personal growth at our Circle Tarot Meetup!Duration: 2hrsWhat to Expect:In this intimate gathering, a tarot reader with 5 years of experience will provide personalized tarot readings for each participant, offering guidance, clarity, and inspiration. Whether you’re a seasoned tarot reader or new to the cards, this is a space for everyone to explore the wisdom of the tarot.Think of it as a round table discussion about tarot. After the tarot reader has given personalised readings for everybody, then, we will discuss opinions about tarot and open the floor for discussion where you can learn a thing or two about how to do these readings for yourself. It’s a great space to start if you are a skeptic.Join us for an evening of discovery, community, and magic. We can’t wait to see you there!

name: The Picnic Rave Experience
description: What happens when the charm of New York’s Central Park, the pulse of music, and the intimacy of real conversations find their way to Bangalore?Introducing The Picnic Party — a 4-hour immersive escape from the digital world.An intentional gathering of 100 people who choose presence over pings, music over noise, and meaningful conversations over endless scrolling.Co-created by The Window Seat — curators of global cultural experiences for Indian audiences — and Kaunversations — creators of thoughtfully designed spaces for deep human connection — this is where the cityscape meets the soulscape.📍 What’s the Experience Like?Vibe:A lush, green escape in Bengaluru — the Garden City.A cozy, colorful picnic where house, R&B, and pop beats flow seamlessly with deep, meaningful conversations.A space to feel at ease, be yourself, and forge genuine connections.A blend of art, music, culture, and community.Setting:• 25 vibrant picnic mats• 5 handpicked strangers per mat• Zero phones• 1 simple rule — Be Present• A live DJ weaving sunlight into sound• Outdoor activities like painting, drawing, frisbee, ball games, and thoughtfully curated connection games by Kaunversations🎟️ Your Ticket Includes:✓ 2 beverages & 2 appetizers from a specially curated menu✓5 Entertainment Zones — a mix of interactive and non-interactive experiences📅 Date: Sunday, 11th May 2025🕙 Time: 09:30 AM – 01:30 PM🎟️ This is an invite-only experience with limited spots available👕 Dress Code: Light blue attire A Sunday evening experience by The Window Seat × Kaunversations

organizer.name: The Window Seat Experiences  & Kaunversations

name: Framing Motion
description: Ronita Mookerji is a choreographer, performer, and contemporary dance artist with 16+ years of experience in interdisciplinary movement arts. She was a Senior Movement Artist at Attakkalari Dance Company for over seven years. Trained in Bharatanatyam for over 25 years and Odissi for two, she is also a certified yoga teacher and Animal Flow practitioner. A graduate of Attakkalari’s Diploma in Movement Arts and Mixed Media, she has trained in Kalaripayattu, Ballet, and Contact Improvisation.As a movement educator, Ronita has taught at institutions like Drama School Mumbai, FTII Pune, and Christ University Bangalore. She has performed and conducted workshops internationally, integrating contemporary dance, Kalaripayattu, and movement exploration.In this unique workshop, Ronita brings her deep dance experience into Animal Flow, blending strength, fluidity, and expressive movement for a dynamic and immersive session.We will incorporate lip smacking dishes from our signature kitchen into the brunch. We're so excited about this unique event because it’s more than just a dance, animal flow session or a brunch, it’s an experience that designed to recharge your body, and syncing with some primal movements.

Let the warmth ease your tension, energize your body, and center your mind.Post-Yoga Hydration – Replenish with a refreshing selection of electrolyte drinks to restore and revive after your flow.Creative Storytelling & Crafts for Kids – While moms enjoy their yoga time, little ones will be engaged in a fun and imaginative session of storytelling and crafts, led by the warm and talented teachers from Kai School.     Spots are limited – reserve yours today and celebrate YOU this Mother’s Day.
